2. Turn on "Include subfolders for File Location Allowlists" if applicable.
3. Select "Add," then enter a Name (e.g., test2) and Description (e.g., test2), and input the file location.
4. Select the appropriate Groups and Computers, then click "Save."




5. Update the policies from the client computer and perform a test.

What happens after adding the file to the whitelist? Please let me know the results of this test and if the issue persists. Also, could you provide your availability for this week or next week, so we can schedule another remote session?

Thank you.

Best Regards,
